update.description:
This pull request adds the perceptor class to the code base. The perceptor class is responsible for extracting perception information from the gamestate, transforming into the agent's local coordinate frame, and passing it to the server to be sent back to the agents. 

More information regarding perceptors can be found here: http://simspark.sourceforge.net/wiki/index.php/Perceptors
update.title: Perceptor Class

content.raw:
Use C+11 type alias instead of `typedef`. It's more powerful (it works with templates for example).

`using AgentBodyMap = std::map<std::string, ignition::math::Vector3<double>>;`
content.html:
Use C+11 type alias instead of typedef. It's more powerful (it works with templates for example).

using AgentBodyMap = std::map<std::string, ignition::math::Vector3<double>>;

content.raw: I am modifying a member variable of _agent in UpdateLandmark. If I make _agent const, the compiler gives me an error.
content.html: I am modifying a member variable of _agent in UpdateLandmark. If I make _agent const, the compiler gives me an error.

content.raw: Move it to the previous line. Yoy can make it a `std::shared_ptr` and forget about the `delete`s in the destructor. Same for the `perceptor` member variable below.
content.html: Move it to the previous line. Yoy can make it a std::shared_ptr and forget about the deletes in the destructor. Same for the perceptor member variable below.

content.raw: Move it to the previous line
Move to the previous line? Review the following instructions too.
content.html: Move to the previous line? Review the following instructions too.

content.raw: `const Agent _agent`? Review the other methods that accept an agent reference as an input parameter.
content.html: const Agent _agent? Review the other methods that accept an agent reference as an input parameter.

content.raw: Mising doxygen `\return` You can also remove the space between `std::vector` and `<ignition::math::Plane ...`
content.html: Mising doxygen \return You can also remove the space between std::vector and <ignition::math::Plane ...
